DataElement.preferredName: Imaging Technique Disease Response National Cancer Institute Reviewer Evaluation Tumor Response Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating the disease response as determined by NCI Reviewers based on imaging scans.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Imaging Technique Disease Response National Cancer Institute Reviewer Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._The National Cancer Institute, part of the National Institutes of Health of the United States Department of Health and Human Services, is the Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research. The National Cancer Institute conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer. Access the National Cancer Institute Web site at http://www.cancer.gov._A person with a responsibility for examining something to make sure that it is adequate, accurate, or correct._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Property.preferredDefinition: The National Cancer Institute, part of the National Institutes of Health of the United States Department of Health and Human Services, is the Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research. The National Cancer Institute conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer. Access the National Cancer Institute Web site at http://www.cancer.gov.:A person with a responsibility for examining something to make sure that it is adequate, accurate, or correct.:Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: The Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research. NCI conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer. Part of the National Institutes of Health of the United States Department of Health and Human Services.
A person with a responsibility for examining something to make sure that it is adequate, accurate, or correct.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: an enumerated list of tumor/disease responses.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: DEATH PRIOR TO COMPLETION OF PROTOCOL CRITERIA

ValueMeaning.preferredName: DEATH PRIOR TO COMPLETION OF PROTOCOL CRITERIA
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._A rule which guides how an activity should be performed._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._The cessation of life.

Concepts.definition: Earlier in time or order.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.
The cessation of life.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesions.

Concepts.definition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesions.

PermissibleValues.value: Insufficient evaluation to determine response status

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Diagnostic tests fail to detect presence of disease.

Concepts.definition: Diagnostic tests fail to detect presence of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To occur again.

Concepts.definition: Happening again (especially at regular intervals).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not provided or available.

Concepts.definition: Not provided or available.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size of a tumor or in the extent of cancer in the body.

Concepts.definition: Return to a former state; a subsidence of the symptoms of a disease process; in cancer, a decrease in the size of a tumor or in the extent of cancer in the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.

Concepts.definition: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a finding of complete response to treatment has not been confirmed.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a finding of complete response to treatment has not been confirmed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is an improvement in the measures of disease burden, meeting a predetermined threshold, but not meeting partial response criteria.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is an improvement in the measures of disease burden, meeting a predetermined threshold, but not meeting partial response criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial response with additional serum and urine M-protein reduction, but not meeting complete response.

Concepts.definition: Partial response with additional serum and urine M-protein reduction, but not meeting complete response.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The confirmed disappearance of all signs of cancer, and absence of molecular or cytogenetic marker of disease, in response to treatment with additional biochemical, immunological and histopathological analyses to verify the CR.

Concepts.definition: The confirmed disappearance of all signs of cancer, and absence of molecular or cytogenetic marker of disease, in response to treatment with additional biochemical, immunological and histopathological analyses to verify the CR.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept annotation and changed case of Long Name. mc 4/11/17

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition._A syndrome characterized by pain, stiffness, and tenderness of the proximal muscle groups including the shoulder, pelvic girdle and the neck. There is no muscle atrophy and muscle biopsies do not reveal pathologic changes. Additional signs and symptoms include low grade fever, fatigue and depression.

Concepts.definition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

A syndrome characterized by pain, stiffness, and tenderness of the proximal muscle groups including the shoulder, pelvic girdle and the neck. There is no muscle atrophy and muscle biopsies do not reveal pathologic changes. Additional signs and symptoms include low grade fever, fatigue and depression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._A syndrome characterized by pain, stiffness, and tenderness of the proximal muscle groups including the shoulder, pelvic girdle and the neck. There is no muscle atrophy and muscle biopsies do not reveal pathologic changes. Additional signs and symptoms include low grade fever, fatigue and depression.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

A syndrome characterized by pain, stiffness, and tenderness of the proximal muscle groups including the shoulder, pelvic girdle and the neck. There is no muscle atrophy and muscle biopsies do not reveal pathologic changes. Additional signs and symptoms include low grade fever, fatigue and depression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.: The act of increasing (something) in size or volume or quantity or scope.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.
The act of increasing (something) in size or volume or quantity or scope.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.: A lack of occurrence or performance.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.
A lack of occurrence or performance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Absence of residual disease based on laboratory techniques.

Concepts.definition: Absence of residual disease based on laboratory techniques.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not responding to treatment.: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: Not responding to treatment.
A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having been established or verified.: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: Having been established or verified.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)

Concepts.definition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Non-CR, Non-PD and Clinically Stable iUPD
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)_An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change._Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.

Concepts.definition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.
Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.

PermissibleValues.value: iCPD or iUPD with clinical progression
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: iCPD or iUPD with clinical progression

ValueMeaning.preferredName: iCPD or iUPD with clinical progression
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiographic progression which has been confirmed by additional imaging showing worsening of initial progression._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging._An evaluation of the clinical response of the disease to the therapy._A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

Concepts.definition: Radiographic progression which has been confirmed by additional imaging showing worsening of initial progression.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.
An evaluation of the clinical response of the disease to the therapy.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

Concepts.definition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: User curated long name to support DCI, Modified RANO, ghd, 04.24.18

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A marked decrease in contrast enhancement that is not due to actual tumor shrinkage, but that may be due to anti-angiogenic therapy or an increase in steroid dosage.

Concepts.definition: A marked decrease in contrast enhancement that is not due to actual tumor shrinkage, but that may be due to anti-angiogenic therapy or an increase in steroid dosage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A radiologic finding observed during magnetic resonance imaging of brain glioblastoma, following concurrent radiotherapy and temozolomide treatment or vaccine therapy. It refers to the false positive finding of progression and enhancement of the lesion. It is considered a treatment effect due to tumor cell necrosis and subsequent edema formation and increased vascular permeability.

Concepts.definition: A radiologic finding observed during magnetic resonance imaging of brain glioblastoma, following concurrent radiotherapy and temozolomide treatment or vaccine therapy. It refers to the false positive finding of progression and enhancement of the lesion. It is considered a treatment effect due to tumor cell necrosis and subsequent edema formation and increased vascular permeability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A natural number greater than twenty-three and less than twenty-five and the quantity that it denotes._Any period of seven consecutive days._A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than twenty-three and less than twenty-five and the quantity that it denotes.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A natural number greater than twenty-three and less than twenty-five and the quantity that it denotes._Any period of seven consecutive days._A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than twenty-three and less than twenty-five and the quantity that it denotes.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unable to be evaluated.

Concepts.definition: Unable to be evaluated.

Concepts.definition: A starting point to which things may be compared.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A finding indicating that a subject has one or more measurable pathological lesions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer based on physical exam, such as palpation.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer based on physical exam, such as palpation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Capable of happening or occurring.: A radiologic finding observed during magnetic resonance imaging of brain glioblastoma, following concurrent radiotherapy and temozolomide treatment. It refers to the false positive finding of progression and enhancement of the lesion. It is considered a treatment effect due to tumor cell necrosis and subsequent edema formation and increased vascular permeability.

Concepts.definition: Capable of happening or occurring.

A radiologic finding observed during magnetic resonance imaging of brain glioblastoma, following concurrent radiotherapy and temozolomide treatment or vaccine therapy. It refers to the false positive finding of progression and enhancement of the lesion. It is considered a treatment effect due to tumor cell necrosis and subsequent edema formation and increased vascular permeability.
